body.p: Couchbase Server 4.5 leaps forward with faster, simpler, and more secure data processing. Take a look at the What's new? section for a list of new features and improvements that are available in this Developer Preview release. This is a developer preview version of Couchbase Server 4.5 and is intended for development purposes only. We consider developer preview releases to have some rough edges and bugs, and may change significantly before the final GA release. This release is not supported in production.

section.title: Upgrade
section.p: Couchbase Server 4.5 Developer Preview (DP) is an early developer milestone update and requires a fresh install. Upgrading from an earlier version of Couchbase Server is not supported.
An upgrade path is not supported from an existing supported release to the Developer Preview release. You need to install your DP release

section.title: Limitations
section.note: Should limitations be noted as part of the feature documentation? Or maybe have them in here and as part of the feature docs

li.p: Full-text search is only supported on a single node in a cluster. You can have multiple nodes in the cluster, but only one node can run the full-text service. We do not prevent you from starting full-text service on multiple nodes. However, if you do, you may encounter unpredictable behavior.

ul.li: The Couchbase Web Console does not display the Query tab if the query node is not installed and running.

row.entry:
Summary: Memory optimized indexes and GSI cannot co-exist. When you enable memory optimized indexes for a cluster, it automatically disables GSI indexes in the cluster.
Workaround: Use MapReduce views to create persisted indexes.

Summary: The new cbq shell does not support the use of OpenSSL.
Workaround: Use self-signed certificates instead.

section.title: Deprecated functionality
section.p:
The following functionality is deprecated, will be deprecated, or is unsupported.
The BASE64() function is deprecated in this release. Use the BASE64_ENCODE() function instead. Also, use the BASE64_DECODE() function to reverse the encoding done by BASE64_ENCODE().
